title: Nextcloud + Letsencrypt
name: nextcloud
description: Combined Nextcloud + Letsencrypt Dockers by Linuxserver.io
note: Template for setting up Nextcloud + Letsencrypt containers in accordance with the guide by macom on the OMV Forum (https://forum.openmediavault.org/index.php?thread/28216-how-to-nextcloud-with-letsencrypt-using-omv-and-docker-compose/). Please check the guide

env.name: PUID
env.label: PUID
env.description: Set the UID of the user ($id user) who should run the containers

env.name: PGID
env.label: PGID
env.description: Set the GID of the user ($id user) who should run the containers

env.name: CONFIG_PATH_LE
env.label: Letsencrypt config-folder
env.description: Folder path where letsencrypt config data will be stored. This should not be on a SD-Card/USB-Stick. For OMV user this should be something like /srv/dev-disk-by-label-something/appdata/letsencrypt

env.name: URL
env.label: URL of domain
env.description: Insert your base-URL of your domain

env.name: SUBDOMAINS_ONLY
env.label: Only subdomains?
env.description: Should the certificate be aquired for subdomains only? Set to 'true' if you dont own the base-URL of your domain (e.g. duckdns.org)

env.name: SUBDOMAINS
env.label: Subdomains
env.description: Enter your preffered subdomains. Multiple entries are comma-seperated without spaces (e.g. www,nextcloud)

env.name: EMAIL
env.label: Email
env.description: Enter E-mail adress for notificaton of certificate expiration notifications

env.name: PORT_HTTPS
env.label: https port
env.description: Enter the port on which the letsencrypt docker should listen for https traffic

env.name: PORT_HTTP
env.label: http port
env.description: Enter the port on which the letsencrypt docker should listen for http traffic. Neccessary for cert validation.

env.name: CONFIG_PATH_DB
env.label: Nextcloud-database config-folder
env.description: Folder path where the Nextcloud-Database will be stored. This should not be on a SD-Card/USB-Stick. For OMV user this should be something like /srv/dev-disk-by-label-something/appdata/nextclouddb

env.name: MYSQL_ROOT_PW
env.label: MYSQL root password
env.description: Set the root password for the database

env.name: MYSQL_DB_PW
env.label: Nextcloud-database password
env.description: Set the password for the Nextcloud-database

env.name: CONFIG_PATH_NC
env.label: Nextcloud config-folder
env.description: Folder path where the Nextcloud configuration will be stored. This should not be on a SD-Card/USB-Stick. For OMV user this should be something like /srv/dev-disk-by-label-something/appdata/nextcloud/config

env.name: DATA_PATH_NC
env.label: Nextcloud data-folder
env.description: Folder path where the Nextcloud data will be stored. This should not be on a SD-Card/USB-Stick. For OMV user this should be something like /srv/dev-disk-by-label-something/appdata/nextcloud/data
